rules: Rule1: If the winery uses oak barrels, then it operates a premium vineyard.
Rule2: Under the condition that the winery uses stainless steel tanks, if the winery has skilled winemakers, then it produces high-quality wine.
Rule3: Whenever the winery possesses French oak, it uses oak barrels.
Rule4: Either the winery has French oak or it has American oak.
Rule5: Provided that the winery possesses American oak, it uses stainless steel tanks.
Rule6: The winery has modern equipment or it employs traditional methods.
Rule7: Under the condition that the winery employs traditional methods, if the winery does not have funding, then it has an ideal climate.
Rule8: The winery has skilled winemakers or it has inexperienced staff.
Rule9: If the winery has inexperienced staff, then, under the condition that it has modern equipment, it uses advanced fermentation techniques.
Rule10: If it is not the case that the winery produces high-quality wine or that having modern equipment implies using advanced fermentation, then the winery's production does not fail.

Rule11: If it is not the case that the negation of 'the winery produces high-quality wine or that having modern equipment implies using advanced fermentation' leads to production failure, then the winery's production succeeds.
facts: Fact1: It is not the case that the winery has an ideal climate.
Fact2: The winery does not operate a premium vineyard.
Fact3: The winery does not use advanced fermentation techniques.
Fact4: The winery does not produce high-quality wine.
Fact5: The winery's production does not succeed.
